title: Broadstreet Secure Important Victory at Home
excerpt: An exciting match saw the team come from behind to secure a crucial three points in front of a packed home crowd. The final score of 28-24 keeps Broadstreet in strong contention for promotion.
content:
Broadstreet delivered a thrilling comeback performance at Ivor Preece Field, securing a vital 28-24 victory against Bedford Athletic in front of a packed home crowd.

First Half

Bedford started strongly, racing into a 14-0 lead within the opening 20 minutes. However, Broadstreet responded with two quick tries before half-time to close the gap to 14-12.

Second Half

The second half was an end-to-end affair with both sides showing attacking intent. A penalty try and a well-worked team effort gave Broadstreet the lead for the first time at 26-17. Bedford fought back with a converted try to make it 26-24, but a late penalty sealed the win for the home side.

Head coach praised the team's resilience and character in what was a must-win game for promotion hopes.

title: Youth Academy Open Day Announced
excerpt: Join us for our annual youth academy open day, welcoming players of all ages and abilities to try rugby.
content:
Broadstreet RFC is delighted to announce our annual Youth Academy Open Day, taking place on Saturday 15 March 2026 at Ivor Preece Field.

The event is open to boys and girls aged 5-17 of all abilities. Whether your child has never picked up a rugby ball or is already playing regularly, our qualified coaches will ensure everyone has a great time.

What to Expect

  • Meet the first team players

title: Community Rugby Day Returns This Spring
excerpt: Our popular community rugby day returns with activities for the whole family and local schools invited.
content:
Following the huge success of last year's event, Broadstreet RFC's Community Rugby Day returns on Saturday 22 March 2026.

The day is designed to bring the local community together through the sport of rugby, with activities for all ages and fitness levels.

Activities Include

  • Touch rugby tournaments for adults
  • Tag rugby for children
  • Rugby fitness bootcamp
  • BBQ and live music in the clubhouse
  • Local school rugby showcase

Entry is free and all are welcome. We look forward to seeing you there!

title: New Women's Team Launches Training Sessions
excerpt: Broadstreet RFC is proud to announce the launch of our new women's rugby section. Training starts Wednesday evenings.
content:
Broadstreet RFC is thrilled to announce the launch of our brand new women's rugby section, starting from February 2026.

Training sessions will take place every Wednesday evening from 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM at Ivor Preece Field. All levels of experience are welcome, from complete beginners to experienced players.

The women's section will be coached by qualified RFU coaches and will look to enter local league competitions for the 2026/27 season.

If you're interested in joining, please email women@broadstreet-rugby.co.uk or simply turn up to a training session.

title: Pre-Season Fitness Programme Revealed
excerpt: Head coach John Smith has unveiled an ambitious pre-season fitness programme ahead of the new campaign.
content:
With the current season drawing to a close, head coach John Smith has already turned his attention to preparing the squad for next season.

The Programme

The six-week pre-season programme will begin in July and includes a mix of strength and conditioning, cardio fitness, and rugby-specific skills work.

Players will train four times per week, with two gym sessions, one track session, and one on-field rugby session.

New players looking to join the squad for next season are encouraged to attend pre-season training. Contact the club for details.
